intro: Ecbolium hyssopus, commonly known as the common hyssopus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and spikes of blue to purple flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has aromatic leaves that are used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb. Ecbolium hyssopus is known for its medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
